name: Belarus
partner: Civic Initiative for Democratic and EuroAtlantic Choice (Civic IDEA)
takeaway: Belarus and China engage in significant military cooperation, including equipment imports, joint education programs, and high-level PLA meetings, showcasing a strong defense partnership. However, there's no evidence of PRC intentions to establish basing or participate in humanitarian efforts in Belarus.

Belarus demonstrates a strategic alignment with China in foreign policy, engaging in joint parliamentary initiatives, financial cooperation, and shared diplomatic positions. Notably, Belarus supports the "one China principle" and shares perspectives on sensitive international issues like Xinjiang, Tibet, and Hong Kong.

Belarus showcases a strong presence of Chinese engagement in its academic landscape, involving research partnerships, Confucius Institutes, and joint training centers with companies like Huawei. The active exchange of students and faculty with various Chinese institutions contributes to a significant level of academic cooperation.

Belarus collaborates extensively with China in law enforcement, counter-terrorism efforts, and judicial training. The country deploys PRC-originated surveillance systems, and while there's no reported presence of PRC-connected gangs, cyber attacks suspected to be from China have targeted Belarus.

Belarus and China maintain a diversified economic relationship, engaging in substantial cooperation and trade, with Belarus participating in the Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB). Notably, there is no evidence of PRC economic coercion or debt restructuring, indicating a stable economic partnership.
description-1: In 2023, Belarus had a GDP per capita of US$7,829 and a total population of 9.15 million people.
description-2: Belarus established full diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China in 1992. Belarus was ranked 167th in Reporters Without Borders‘ 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Not Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 8/100.

Media.evidence:
"The official ceremony of concluding the Agreement ""On the exchange of delegations and cooperation in the field of journalism"" was held on April 26 simultaneously in Minsk and Beijing. The document was signed between the Belarusian Union of Journalists (BUJ) and the All-China Association of Journalists (VJA).
The agreement provides for the exchange of journalistic experience, organization of press tours and interviews, internships for Belarusian journalists in China and Chinese journalists in Belarus to study and implement the best practices in media development, participation in media forums and seminars. 
(see below URL)

http://www.dompressy.by/2022/04/26/belorusskie-i-kitajskie-zhurnalisty-podpisali-soglashenie-o-sotrudnichestve/ 
"
Media.note:
"Dunhuang is hosting the Media Cooperation Forum on Belt and Road which brought together more than 300 participants from 127 countries. The organizer of the event is Renmin Ribao. The forum features an important meeting of the world media, politicians and international experts. Belarus is represented by the Belarusian news agency BelTA, the publishing house Zvyazda and the Respublika newspaper.

https://www.belarus.by/en/business/business-news/chinas-peoples-daily-launches-media-center-to-promote-road-and-belt-cooperation_i_0000064557.html"

"The media center will be used primarily for educational purposes. With the number of foreign students growing, the department needs to provide practical training for them. Thanks to the media center project, the department will have a better means to assess student's professional skills. Belarusian students will use the center as well.

https://eng.belta.by/society/view/belarus-china-media-center-to-open-at-bsu-journalism-department-125544-2019/

The Belarus International Radio is launching a programme of specialised training jointly with the School of Journalism and Communication of the Luoyang Normal University from Chinese Henan. Young journalists from China will act as Belarus radio presenters in the Chinese language. In addition, joint programmes and radio bridges dedicated to the topic of Belarusian-Chinese co-operation will be organised.

https://www.sb.by/en/young-chinese-journalists-to-undergo-training-with-belarus-radio-.html"

Foreign Policy.evidence:
The Belarusian side fully adheres to the principle of "One China."

In a joint declaration on September 15, 2022, Belarus reaffirmed its commitment to the "One China" principle, expressing support for China's efforts to restore its sovereignty and opposing Taiwan's independence "in all its manifestations."

Foreign Policy.evidence:
"Press Secretary Andrei Popov responds to a media question over the events in Urumqi in Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region of the People’s Republic of China:
""We carefully watch the events in this region. We took with regret the reports about riots there that entailed human losses and considerable damage. We note that the Chinese authorities undertake needed measures to contain and discontinue this conflict. We express condolences to relatives and next of kin to those perished, as well as our sympathy with those who suffered due to the unrest. We confirm that the Republic of Belarus considers the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region as an integral part of China and believe that events happening there are China’s internal affair. We hope that the legal measures taken by the Chinese authorities to break off the conflict will allow to normalize situation in the region in the near future""            https://www.mfa.gov.by/en/press/news_mfa/df0d82eacc0bde9b.html"

""Belarus is deeply convinced that sustainable and effective development is impossible without political stability and national unity and integrity; this is why any separatist activity is totally incompatible with achieving prosperity and stability of the nation, and this is why we welcome the new law,"" Ambrazevich said.

Khitchadeth said the enforcement of the national security law in Hong Kong ""is very necessary in order to better protect the rights and freedom of Hong Kong residents in a safe environment"".

The Confucius Classroom of BSU RISC at BSEU operates based on the agreement signed in November 2012 between the BSU Republican Institute of Sinology named after Confucius and the Belarusian State Economic University, as well as on the approved Regulations on the Confucius Classroom at BSEU. He explained his rationale: “China’s investment has never had any political strings attached, therefore, we are more than willing to see China speed up its investment in Belarus on a larger scale.”            https://harvardpolitics.com/china-and-belarus-a-special-relationship/                        In 2005, Lukashenko told Xinhua, China’s official news agency, the reason for his newfound attraction to Beijing: “So long as we [Belarus] develop such relations with China, we cannot be isolated.” https://carnegiemoscow.org/commentary/82662                                                            We really would like to use China's reform experience: Russian, Belarusian officials.

Domestic Politics.note:
"Legitimization of the political course for the domestic audience. China is often mentioned in official conspiracy narratives about the reasons for the large-scale protest movement in 2020–2021, the motives for Western sanctions, and the background of a sharp deterioration in relations with Western countries. In such rhetoric, these events are presented as a consequence of a global conspiracy against Belarus, China, and Russia. (However, no direct evidence of suppression is identified)
https://library.fes.de/pdf-files/bueros/belarus/19851-20221220.pdf"

Economy.evidence:
"China’s economic presence in the region has been steadily growing since the late 2000s, with Belarus clearly becoming China’s primary partner. China provided Belarus with an extensive set of economic cooperation tools, including the flagship project of the “Great Stone” Chinese-Belarusian Industrial Park near Minsk, as well as credit lines aimed at developing infrastructure and industry. Belarus has also become a key transit country for rapidly increasing Eurasian railway connections, facilitating 90% of EU-China railway freight trade. (see below URL)

https://cepa.org/the-belarus-china-iron-brotherhood-begins-to-rust/ 

Since 2020, China has been Belarus’s second-largest trading partner after Russia, with the trade balance being strongly negative.

https://library.fes.de/pdf-files/bueros/belarus/19851-20221220.pdf

The major trading partners are the Russian Federation, Ukraine, China, Germany, Poland, the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, Lithuania, the Netherlands, Kazakhstan, Turkey and Italy. 

https://president.gov.by/en/belarus/economics/foreign-trade/key-trade-partners"

Belarus-China Cultural and Diplomatic Relations:

1. Days of Belarus in China
The head of the Chinese department congratulated Belarus on the successful launch of the Days of Belarus in China, running until December 2.
Source: https://mfa.gov.by/en/press/news_mfa/f8973745c5ddd388.html

2. Chinese Cultural Center in Minsk
Announced in 2015 by Presidents Xi Jinping and Alexander Lukashenko.
Opened on December 21, 2016, in Minsk.
Source: https://china.aiddata.org/projects/67296/

3. "Centenary of the Communist Party of China" Photo Exhibition (2021)
Highlighted China’s development with four detailed expositions.
Source: https://library.fes.de/pdf-files/bueros/belarus/19851-20221220.pdf

4. Cultural Relations Growth
Enhanced since 2007, institutionalized in 2013 under a joint declaration.
Includes education cooperation protocols.
Source: https://www.bmlv.gv.at/pdf_pool/publikationen/book_chinas_footprint_09_the_sino_belarusian_relationship.pdf

Society.note:
"""We share a common Soviet background and we came out of communism. Their parents and my parents lived in approximately the same conditions, so they are understandable to me as a nation. It seems to me that we share something in common in mentality. We, Belarusians, are hardworking, and the Chinese are also so hardworking, ready to endure for the sake of some idea, a brighter future"".
"" I would say that it is easier for Belarusians to find a common language with the Chinese than for Russians. Belarusians do not impose their point of view, and they communicate well with other people. Therefore, the Chinese see us as friendly and pleasant people. But in general, Belarusians are closer to the European way, the European mentality. We are, after all, a European country."" 

https://belsat.eu/ru/news/07-04-2022-chto-obshhego-u-belarusi-i-kitaya-i-mozhno-li-nazvat-podnebesnuyu-drugom-belarusi-opyt-belorusov-zhivushhih-v-kitae/"
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by Ani Kintsurashvili

Military.note:
"On June 21, the Belarussian Defense Ministry announced that China would be providing Belarus with new armored vehicles. The move is just the latest sign of a growing partnership between Minsk and Beijing, including in the security realm. Though China and Belarus established relations 25 years ago, ties have been strengthening in recent years. Last year, Chinese President Xi Jinping and Belarussian President Alexander Lukashenko upgraded relations to the level of a comprehensive strategic partnership, an endeavor first announced in 2013. (see below URL 1)

On July 3 Belarus marked 73 years since Minsk was liberated from the Nazis by Soviet forces. The public holiday was accompanied by a requisite military parade. The event served as a reminder of a growing reliance on China as a would-be ally. Another Chinese 4×4 spotted in the July 3 parade is the VN3/VN4. Deliveries of this particular armored car only began in mid-2017 and it’s further proof that internal security is a serious preoccupation for the Lukashenko regime. The VN3/VN4 is designed to carry at least eight passengers behind its cab. A roof hatch supports a turret and in Belarusian service it’s armed with a manually operated 12.7mm NSV machine gun in a cupola. (see below URL 2)

https://thediplomat.com/2017/06/china-gives-belarus-new-armored-vehicles/ 

https://21stcenturyasianarmsrace.com/2017/07/09/the-belarusian-army-is-using-a-lot-of-chinese-hardware/ 
China Gives Belarus New Armored Vehicles
https://thediplomat.com/tag/china-belarus-military/"

Military.evidence: Around 77 servicemen of the Armed Forces of Belarus received education in the institutions of the Chinese People’s Liberation Army. The two countries also hold regular joint army training exercises. For example, “Hunting Falcon” is a regular exercise designed to strengthen the partnership between the two armies in counteracting terrorist threats. This commitment to military cooperation is further evidenced by the amount of high level exchanges between the two countries. From 2013 to 2017 representatives of the Belarusian Defense Ministry visited China seven times while delegations of the Chinese Defense Ministry paid eleven visits to Belarus.                                                        http://minskdialogue.by/en/research/memorable-notes/belarus-china-relations                  JINAN, Aug. 7 (ChinaMil) -- Chinese and Belarusian special operations forces commenced the joint training entitled “Eagle Assault 2018” at a comprehensive training base attached to the Northern Theater Command of the Chinese People’s Liberation Army (PLA) in Jinan City of east China's Shandong Province on the morning of August 5, 2018.                                           http://eng.chinamil.com.cn/view/2018-08/07/content_9244657.htm                                   Belarus, China to advance cooperation in military education                                      https://www.belarus.by/en/government/events/belarus-china-to-advance-cooperation-in-military-education_i_0000128626.html
